title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and visualize their sleep debt. This repository focuses on providing a simple and effective tool for understanding sleep patterns and promoting better sleep habits, leveraging TypeScript for robust code and modern web technologies for a user-friendly experience. The project highlights practical application of TypeScript principles in a web development context.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a platform for creating and participating in various types of votes. It offers a user-friendly interface and leverages modern web technologies to facilitate efficient and transparent decision-making within communities or organizations.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository showcases the process of generating map-based representations of data, focusing on effective data display and geographic analysis techniques.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based web application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. It serves as a project implementing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionalities using these technologies, providing a practical example of a full-stack application and demonstrating the integration of Python, Flask, and a relational database.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository is a project implementing a web-based dashboard for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets, built using JavaScript, Python (likely for backend services), HTML, and CSS. It provides a user interface for visualizing robot status, managing tasks, and potentially sending commands to robots within a Robofleet ecosystem.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a demonstration of a modern, responsive dashboard interface. It explores key dashboard concepts and provides a foundation for building data-driven applications.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focused on [Insert specific purpose of the project here, e.g., "providing a robust event tracking solution," or "implementing a modern web application framework"]. It leverages these technologies to deliver [Mention key features or goals, e.g., "efficient data collection," or "a modular and scalable architecture"]. This repository serves as the central location for development, issue tracking, and contributions related to the Raven-v2 project.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, implemented using a combination of TeX for the main document and HTML for supplemental web-based versions or information. As a "project", this repo showcases my ability to present professional information using both traditional typesetting and modern web development techniques.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web application designed to facilitate brainstorming and project planning. Built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, this project offers a dynamic and interactive platform for users to capture, organize, and refine their ideas, making it a valuable tool for project management and collaborative innovation.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project utilizing TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML, built with Vite.js and Express.js, to create a platform that integrates with the Gemini API. This repository showcases the development of a modern web application leveraging cutting-edge technologies for interactive communication.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a web-based project built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to create and manage dynamic event schedules. This repository provides the core codebase for implementing an interactive calendar interface, allowing users to easily add, view, and organize events. It serves as a practical demonstration of front-end development techniques and provides a foundational structure for building more complex event management applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, styled with Tailwind CSS, and utilizing Supabase for backend services. This repository demonstrates a modern approach to tracking IoT assets, showcasing best practices in full-stack development with Next.js, efficient styling with Tailwind CSS, and robust data management using Supabase.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log data, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS logs, aiding in debugging and understanding robot behavior, making it a valuable asset for robotics development and troubleshooting.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains projects related to financial analysis and modeling. It serves as a practical resource for learning and applying Python to various finance-related tasks, covering topics like portfolio optimization, risk management, and time series analysis.

title: atg-world
description: The `atg-world` repository is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It explores and implements various features related to [Clearly define the project's purpose, for example: "interactive maps," "data visualization," or "a portfolio website"]. The codebase showcases modern web development techniques and best practices while covering topics such as [Mention a specific topic if you have one, like "component-based architecture" or "responsive design"].

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with CSS, showcasing a modern web application development approach. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management and utilizes Material UI (MUI) components for a clean and responsive user interface, serving as a practical example for developers working with these technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a modern e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a polished user interface. This repository serves as a practical example of a type-safe, front-end focused e-commerce application, showcasing best practices for building scalable and maintainable web applications.
